member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.AddLMUSUserCmdlet
member.summary: Associates the user to an EC2 instance to utilize user-based subscriptions.

para.para: The directory ID for an Active Directory identity provider.
The domain name of the user.
The ID of the EC2 instance, which provides user-based subscriptions.
The user name from the identity provider for the user.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.AddLMUSUserCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'InstanceUserSummary'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.LicenseManagerUserSubscriptions.Model.AssociateUserResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.LicenseManagerUserSubscriptions.Model.AssociateUserResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.AddLMUSUserCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the InstanceId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^InstanceId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.AddLMUSUserCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.GetLMUSIdentityProviderListCmdlet
member.summary:
Lists the identity providers for user-based subscriptions.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para: Maximum number of results to return in a single call.
Token for the next set of results.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.GetLMUSIdentityProviderListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'IdentityProviderSummaries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.LicenseManagerUserSubscriptions.Model.ListIdentityProvidersResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.LicenseManagerUserSubscriptions.Model.ListIdentityProvidersResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.GetLMUSIdentityProviderListCmdlet.NoAutoIteration
member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.GetLMUSInstanceListCmdlet
member.summary:
Lists the EC2 instances providing user-based subscriptions.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para: An array of structures that you can use to filter the results to those that match one or more sets of key-value pairs that you specify.
Maximum number of results to return in a single call.
Token for the next set of results.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.GetLMUSInstanceListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'InstanceSummaries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.LicenseManagerUserSubscriptions.Model.ListInstancesResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.LicenseManagerUserSubscriptions.Model.ListInstancesResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.GetLMUSInstanceListCmdlet.NoAutoIteration
member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.GetLMUSProductSubscriptionListCmdlet
member.summary:
Lists the user-based subscription products available from an identity provider.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para: The directory ID for an Active Directory identity provider.
An array of structures that you can use to filter the results to those that match one or more sets of key-value pairs that you specify.
The name of the user-based subscription product.
Maximum number of results to return in a single call.
Token for the next set of results.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.GetLMUSProductSubscriptionListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'ProductUserSummaries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.LicenseManagerUserSubscriptions.Model.ListProductSubscriptionsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.LicenseManagerUserSubscriptions.Model.ListProductSubscriptionsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.GetLMUSProductSubscriptionListCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Product parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Product' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.GetLMUSProductSubscriptionListCmdlet.NoAutoIteration
member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.GetLMUSUserAssociationListCmdlet
member.summary:

This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para: The directory ID for an Active Directory identity provider.
An array of structures that you can use to filter the results to those that match one or more sets of key-value pairs that you specify.
The ID of the EC2 instance, which provides user-based subscriptions.
Maximum number of results to return in a single call.
Token for the next set of results.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.GetLMUSUserAssociationListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'InstanceUserSummaries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.LicenseManagerUserSubscriptions.Model.ListUserAssociationsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.LicenseManagerUserSubscriptions.Model.ListUserAssociationsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the InstanceId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^InstanceId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.RegisterLMUSIdentityProviderCmdlet
member.summary: Registers an identity provider for user-based subscriptions.

para.para: The directory ID for an Active Directory identity provider.
The name of the user-based subscription product.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.RegisterLMUSIdentityProviderCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'IdentityProviderSummary'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.LicenseManagerUserSubscriptions.Model.RegisterIdentityProviderResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.LicenseManagerUserSubscriptions.Model.RegisterIdentityProviderResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.RegisterLMUSIdentityProviderCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Product parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Product' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.RegisterLMUSIdentityProviderCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.RemoveLMUSUserCmdlet
member.summary: Disassociates the user from an EC2 instance providing user-based subscriptions.

para.para: The directory ID for an Active Directory identity provider.
The domain name of the user.
The ID of the EC2 instance, which provides user-based subscriptions.
The user name from the identity provider for the user.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.RemoveLMUSUserCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'InstanceUserSummary'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.LicenseManagerUserSubscriptions.Model.DisassociateUserResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.LicenseManagerUserSubscriptions.Model.DisassociateUserResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.RemoveLMUSUserCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the InstanceId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^InstanceId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.RemoveLMUSUserCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.StartLMUSProductSubscriptionCmdlet
member.summary: Starts a product subscription for a user with the specified identity provider.

para.para: The directory ID for an Active Directory identity provider.
The domain name of the user.
The name of the user-based subscription product.
The user name from the identity provider of the user.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.StartLMUSProductSubscriptionCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'ProductUserSummary'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.LicenseManagerUserSubscriptions.Model.StartProductSubscriptionResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.LicenseManagerUserSubscriptions.Model.StartProductSubscriptionResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.StartLMUSProductSubscriptionCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Username parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Username' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.StartLMUSProductSubscriptionCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.StopLMUSProductSubscriptionCmdlet
member.summary: Stops a product subscription for a user with the specified identity provider.

para.para: The directory ID for an Active Directory identity provider.
The domain name of the user.
The name of the user-based subscription product.
The user name from the identity provider for the user.

member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'ProductUserSummary'. Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.LicenseManagerUserSubscriptions.Model.StopProductSubscriptionResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Username parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Username' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.LMUS.StopLMUSProductSubscriptionCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
